text: The 2010 Africa Cup of Nations was the 27th Africa Cup of Nations tournament. It took place in Angola from 10 January to 31 January. Egypt won the tournament after defeating Ghana. Lastly, Nigeria got third place. == Results == === Group Stage === Key to colours in group tables Team advanced to the semi-finals. ====Group A==== Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts Angola 3 1 2 0 6 4 +2 5 Algeria 3 1 1 1 1 3 −2 4 Mali 3 1 1 1 7 6 +1 4 Malawi 3 1 0 2 4 5 –1 3 ==== Group B ==== Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts Ivory Coast 2 1 1 0 3 1 +2 4 Ghana 2 1 0 1 2 3 –1 3 Burkina Faso 2 0 1 1 0 1 –1 1 Togo withdrew ====Group C==== Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts Egypt 3 3 0 0 7 1 +6 9 Nigeria 3 2 0 1 5 3 +2 6 Benin 3 0 1 2 2 5 –3 1 Mozambique 3 0 1 2 2 7 –5 1 ====Group D==== Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts Zambia 3 1 1 1 5 5 0 4 Cameroon 3 1 1 1 5 5 0 4 Gabon 3 1 1 1 2 2 0 4 Tunisia 3 0 3 0 3 3 0 3 === Knockout stage === {{Round8 |24 January – Luanda||0||1 |25 January – Lubango||0 (4)| (p)|0 (5) |24 January – Cabinda||2| (aet)|3 |25 January – Benguela| (aet)|3||1 |28 January – Luanda||1||0 |28 January – Benguela||0||4 |31 January – Luanda||0||1 }} == References == Category:2010 in association football Category:Africa Cup of Nations tournaments Category:Football in Angola Category:2010s in Africa Category:21st century in Angola Category:January 2010 events
